wikipedia_page.main: Cyril Montague Pennington-Richards (17 December 1911 – 2 January 2005) was a British film director and cinematographer.

response: Hour of Decision is a 1957 British mystery film directed by C.M. Pennington-Richards and starring Jeff Morrow, Hazel Court and Anthony Dawson.

Stormy Crossing is a 1958 British crime, drama, thriller, mystery film directed by C.M. Pennington-Richards and starring John Ireland, Derek Bond, Leslie Dwyer, and Maureen Connell. John Schlesinger and Arthur Lowe appear in supporting roles. It was made at Southall Studios in West London, and released in the U.S. as Black Tide.

Ladies Who Do is a 1963 British comedy film directed by C.M. Pennington-Richards starring Peggy Mount, Robert Morley and Harry H. Corbett. It was shot at Twickenham Studios and on location around London.

Mystery Submarine is a 1963 British war film directed by C.M. Pennington-Richards and starring Edward Judd, James Robertson Justice and Laurence Payne.BFI.org A captured German submarine is used by the Royal Navy to trick a German force aiming to intercept a supply convoy. The film is based on a play by Jon Manchip White.

The Oracle (known as The Horse's Mouth in the United States ) is a 1953 British comedy film directed by C.M. Pennington-Richards and starring Robert Beatty, Michael Medwin and Virginia McKenna. The screenplay concerns a journalist who goes on holiday to Ireland where he encounters a fortune-teller.
